meanings.definition: A loud, explosive noise or sound.
meanings.sent1: The fragor of the fireworks filled the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The fragor of the thunderstorm could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent3: The fragor of the balloon popping made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The fragor of the crashing waves against the rocks was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The fragor of the lion's roar echoed through the jungle.

meanings.sent1: The fragor of the falling tree branches startled the hikers.
meanings.sent2: The fragor of the car accident could be heard from the street.
meanings.sent3: The fragor of the books falling off the shelf made a mess.
meanings.sent4: The fragor of the glass shattering was alarming.
meanings.sent5: The fragor of the hammer hitting the nail echoed in the room.

meanings.sent1: The fragor of the door slamming shut made her jump.
meanings.sent2: The fragor of the alarm clock woke him up abruptly.
meanings.sent3: The fragor of the balloon popping surprised everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The fragor of the gunshot echoed in the empty street.
meanings.sent5: The fragor of the firecracker startled the birds in the tree.
